original_solution_mapping.L1: Dimes are worth $0.10 and Barry has $10.00 worth of dimes so he has 10/.10 = <<10/.10=100>>100 dimes
original_solution_mapping.L2: Dan has half the amount of dimes as Barry so Dan has 100/2 = <<100/2=50>>50 dimes
original_solution_mapping.L3: Dan finds 2 more dimes on his way home so he now has 50+2 = <<50+2=52>>52 dimes

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5824.
    Returns: the total number of dimes Dan has.
    """
    # L1
    barry_total_value = 10.00 # $10.00 worth of dimes
    dime_value = 0.10 # WK
    barry_num_dimes = barry_total_value / dime_value

    # L2
    dan_half_divisor = 2 # half that amount
    dan_initial_dimes = barry_num_dimes / dan_half_divisor

    # L3
    dan_found_dimes = 2 # finds 2 more dimes
    dan_total_dimes = dan_initial_dimes + dan_found_dimes

    # FA
    answer = dan_total_dimes
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Dimes are worth $0.10 and Barry has ${barry_total_value} worth of dimes so he has {barry_total_value}/{dime_value} = <<{barry_total_value}/{dime_value}={barry_num_dimes}>>{barry_num_dimes} dimes
Dan has half the amount of dimes as Barry so Dan has {barry_num_dimes}/{dan_half_divisor} = <<{barry_num_dimes}/{dan_half_divisor}={dan_initial_dimes}>>{dan_initial_dimes} dimes
Dan finds {dan_found_dimes} more dimes on his way home so he now has {dan_initial_dimes}+{dan_found_dimes} = <<{dan_initial_dimes}+{dan_found_dimes}={dan_total_dimes}>>{dan_total_dimes} dimes
